casebody.data:
Sandra Lee BECKER, etc., et al., Plaintiffs, Richard Guy Steffel, Plaintiff-Appellant, v. John R. THOMPSON, etc., et al., Defendants-Appellees. No. 71-1856. United States Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. May 28, 1974. Howard Moore, Jr., Peter E. Rinds-kopf, William H. Traylor, Emory University School of Law, John R. Myer, Atlanta, Ga., for plaintiff-appellant. Robert E. Mozley, George P. Dillard, Decatur, Ga., Dock H. Davis, Atlanta, Ga., for defendants-appellees.

Before TUTTLE, GEWIN and DYER, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM:

In accordance with the mandate of the Supreme Court of the United States, 94 S.Ct. 1209, 39 L.Ed.2d 505, which reversed 5 Cir., 459 F.2d 919, 463 F.2d 1338, the judgment of the district court, 334 F.Supp. 1386, is reversed and the cause is remanded for further proceedings in conformity with the opinion of the Supreme Court.
